column4: anyone knows how to fix so that ubuntu works with the nikon d300s
what does dmesg say when you plug it in?
dmesg | tail tells me new "usb 1-3: high speed device using ehci_hcd and address 4"
with f-spot it just says unspecified error
but f-spot uses gphoto2 i think
I've never had much success with gphoto, I've always tried to find devices that work as a mass storage
i got it too work with gphoto2 but only when the device is unmounted
but i see now that i should get a cardreader this drains the battery bad
yea if you get a card reader ubuntu should automagically mount a directory onto your desktop
yeah i think that is the best, and a bit faster. the raw files is pretty big :)
